Reviews.Title: “Decent, inexpensive and close to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: FormerTravelAgent36
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel September 2011 for 3 nights and found it to be perfectly fine. It was close to many restaurants, attractions and the airport. I would say the only issue we had with the hotel was the limited parking available, but even though the garage was pretty full we were still able to find a spot. The daily breakfast was very good but it did get pretty crowded so get there early. Our room was clean and accommodated 2 adults and 2 young children easily. We honestly did not have a problem with noise at all so don't worry too much about it. We enjoyed the pool area due it being quiet and very clean. I think this hotel is very nice and was the best value for the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice well maintained hotel.”
Reviews.Author: davidkoch126
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago on business, and decided to stay again when coming to town for pleasure. The Amtrak and local trolly run right behind the hotel, so there is noise from that, however I rarely heard anything when I was asleep. I found the front desk staff to be friendly and knowledgeable. Close to the Maritime museum and USS Midway. A short trolly ride ($5 all day) to Old Towne, Gaslamp district, Seaport village and Petco Park.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: HiltonDiamond1
Reviews.Content: This property is close to the airport and little Italy with a new lobby and excellent service. I was impressed during several interactions with front desk staff -- check in, check out and assistance finding a restaurant -- and with the courteous service of the driver during the ride to the airport. On the down side, this is an older Hampton, with small, but clean, rooms. If quiet is a top priority, choose an alternate location. Overnight business travelers with a need to be close to the airport, an appreciation for courteous service and appetite for a good Italian meal, should consider this location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let a little noise make your decision”
Reviews.Author: sgtevil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for two nights after doing extensive research of where to stay in San Diego. I decided to follow other reviewers and asked for a front room. I was given a side room facing the courtyard. Yes, there are trains, but no matter where you stay downtown there are trains, and you can hear them no matter where you really are. The train tracks are directly behind the hotel, and there are several trains that go by, and yes they blow their horns. But, being only 4 window lengths away from the tracks, I can honestly say that the noise was not as bad as some people wrote about. That was the ONLY reason why I was not going to use it. But there was a special on expedia for a very good price so I grabbed it and hoped for the best. First and foremost, my BIGGEST RAVE about this hotel is that due to scheduling I arrived at 11:30am or so, check in is not until 4pm. I expected to be told to leave my luggage secured and hopefully by 2pm I could get a room . Once I went to the desk, the clerk, who was very friendly, informed me that my room was ready and gave me the keys. Not too many places would do that! The lobby is open, clean, there are 2 computers, 1 is strictly for boarding pass/airline info and the other was a general use one. I read someplace here that the elevator were slow, that I have to agree with, if your in a rush in the morning you can wait up to 5 min to get one, and there are 4 of them. I guess maybe the cleaning carts are blocking them or something, but once the afternoon rolls around they are fine. The room was clean, they wash all the bedding after each guest which is a plus, as I said my view was the courtyard, 4 windows away from the tracks, with the air on in the room we did not hear much at all. We are heavy sleepers, so that may have something to do with it, but you are given ear plugs everyday left on your pillows, we did not need or use them. I do have to add that the train was loud when we were awake in the room without the air on and the tv low, but that cannot be avoided, and most of the hotels in this area have that problem. The pool was clean as was the pool area, it was too cold for my liking, as it was chilly out there, but my son swam in it without a problem. There is also a little patio area outside of the gated pool where you can sit and enjoy a book, coffee, or just relax on a nice day. Breakfast, which is included is your typical Hampton Inn breakfast. cereal, muffins, eggs, Belgium waffles, coffee, juice, tea. We only had the waffles and muffins and they were good, and the food area was clean and constantly being cleaned by the staff working there. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate is available 24 hrs. There is a shuttle that will take you places other than the airport or the scheduled zoo trip, those take priority but if they are free they will take you within a certain radius, we used it to go to a popular taco place about 2 miles away and picked back up again, all within a reasonable time, just make sure they have no airport trips scheduled or you will have to wait or take the trolley which is also right there. I cannot stress enough how great the staff was, friendly, professional, and were always on top of their game. They offered suggestions on where to go without even asking. Very great staff! There is also an exercise room, again a typical hotel gym, nothing huge, treadmill, weights, bike, elliptical, and a TV. We checked it out and it was clean and had cleaning stuff for after using the machines. My son used it the days we were there and said it was good enough to keep up your routine. Make sure you book your airport shuttle the day before, they ask for 24 hrs notice, I just booked it when i got there so I wouldn't forget. The shuttle driver for the airport was prompt, and left on time. Once again, great service. The area around the hotel, and generally the whole seaport area does have a lot of homeless people around but they really do not bother you. I am a mother with 2 kids and went out at night walking around and felt safe. Another great deal is your a few blocks from Little Italy, and across the street you have the USS Midway, and Seaport. Great shops, food, and scenery. I would recommend giving this hotel a chance and put aside the train noise, it was worth the money, clean, helpful and just an overall greatly centered place.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AND INCREDIBLY LOUD!!!”
Reviews.Author: BGHera
Reviews.Content: I'm really at a loss trying to describe this hotel! I actually paid for 2 nights at this hotel and had my mother, sister and niece with me. It was so embarrassing that I found myself apologizing over and over for the state of the hotel and for booking us there. I have been a Diamond member of the Hilton chain for a long time and have stayed virtually all over the world with them. I can safely say that this hotel ranks as the worst! Aside from the train noise (which is not mentioned anywhere that I can see on the hotel website), there is trolley noise, street noise and the thinnest walls at the hotel itself. The service (if you could call it that) at the front desk was awful. I was speaking directly to the front desk person and she's looking off into space somewhere! It took at least 15 minutes to check in when there was no one else in line - which most Hilton Honors guests know is a bit long as especially in a small hotel. What happened to the zip in/zip out check in? I asked if there was a room upgrade available and she did not even pretend to look at her computer, just said "no" . Okay fair enough, maybe she knew her inventory. She handed me the room keys without further explaining about how or where to get access to the parking and how to get to the room. She just looked bored and zoned out most of the time. It was not hard to figure it out the logistics, so we managed, but it would have been nice to act like she cared. The room itself so incredibly dingy, small and cramped, that hadn't it been close to midnight, I would have moved us to another hotel. I was glad I remembered to bring my flip flops from home because the carpet was nasty looking and felt it too! The noise from the train did stop at midnight but started up at 6:00 a.m. However, the hotel sits right on a busy street which was very loud with road noise. Oh yeah, the garbage trucks early in the morning were wonderful to hear too! Then there was the noise from all the airplanes flying overheard. Needless to say the dinky little ear plugs did NOT help. Even noise cancelling headphones didn't help! Anyway, when morning did finally come after the miserably noisy night, I decided to look out the window since we had a view of the pool. It was really dirty with a lot of leaves in it. Ick! When I went to check out after we were done with the 2 days, I had different front desk people awaiting. They were more interested in talking to each other about what was going on in their world than helping me check out. I waited a good 10 minutes before they finished conversing. Absolutely no apologies for anything whatsoever!!! I know that I didn't pay all that much (although $205 per night for an extremely subpar hotel is a lot as far as I'm concerned!) but I certainly should have warranted a certain amount of respect since I was a guest of the hotel (as ANY guest should)! Lesson learned - never again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are not a train LOVER don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marchoffmann314
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were in any other location it would be a nice hotel. Unfortunately, it is located right downtown in San Diego where all forms of traffic come together and can be heard all through the night. Planes from nearby San Diego airport roar overhead and the "normal" downtown noise from cars can be heard in the room. But the worst are the trains. The hotel is located right on the train tracks running through downtown. Even though we had a room as far away as possible from the tracks it was impossible to get any sleep without ear plugs (my wife used them, but I needed to listen for the kids). The constant (oftentimes several times per minute) arrival of all kinds of trains, trams and locomotives announced by their horns, bells and whistles was accompanied by the fantastic cling-clang of the railroad crossing sign, which is at the corner if the hotel. I am sure a train lover would have enjoyed staying up all night spending time identifying every type of engine and car rattling by. I really didn't, as I was hoping for a night of rest after a week of visiting Southern California amusement parks. The hotel itself is not bad and, as noted, close to downtown and the airport (which was our reason for selecting it). If you choose to stay, I can only recommend taking ear plugs and some sleep medication.

Reviews.Title: “Reliability at its finest”
Reviews.Author: shangoodjack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn downtown for a conference. This was a last minute hotel since after arriving at the hotel that was originally booked it was awful. I did note rate this a 5 simply because one of the front desk staff persons Blanca was absolutely clueless about everything I asked. Prior to my arrival, I called and asked about the train informtion since it runs right behind the hotel. What station do I enter when taking Amtrack (from LA?) She coudnt help me. Once I got the station, they provided what I needed. Upon arrival, she was there and I asked for extra towels(directly). After waiting for an hour I called from the room asking her for the towels. She apologized and told me that she had sent them, but to the wrong room. HUH? One evening I asked for suggestions on things to do in the area. She simply circled a few places on the map and said that it usually is a personal choice on best restaurants. I was a bit taken aback. Since she worked days, I waited for the evening shift to ask the exact same questions. The answers were completely different. Alex was wonderful. I had friends meet me at the hotel and he gave us great ideas on places to eat and enjoy ourselves. The hotel was practical and exactly what I needed on this trip. Blanca however needs additional training before being placed at the front desk answering questions and providing what I consider just basic information. Overall good stay and the hotel was what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Service Can't be Beat!”
Reviews.Author: Jalby
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Hampton Inn Downtown San Diego, and have nothing but positive comments. We could see the train tracks from our room, but the trains are working toward a mandatory quiet zone that kicks in at night and I never heard the trains one time after going to bed. Every member of the staff we encountered (except one late afternoon female reception clerk with dark curly hair) treated us like royalty! Nate at the front desk – UNBELIEVABLE- really. No matter what your question is or what you might need- He’s the MAN! Best restaurant advice, best directions, even told us what to tell the cabbie so we went the shortest route and got the best rate! He called a cab for us one night- then a few minutes later other patrons were dropped off by a cab- so he said- jump in- and he called the cab company back and cancelled the other cab. You are in GOOD hands with Nate!! We enjoyed a FREE delicious breakfast every morning. Hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, seemed to rotate between sausage patties, smoked sausage and sausage gravy. Fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, make your own waffles, English muffins, Danishes, bagels, toast, a variety of delicious muffins. Condiments such as syrup, jellies, peanut butter, honey. Fruit juice, hot tea, hot chocolate and 3 varieties of coffee. Cold cereal and milk- even pitchers of ice water. A couple of mornings when we passed through the lobby they had bags of (FREE) fresh (warm) chocolate chip cookies. Since we were only there that time of day twice- I'm not sure if that's something they do every day or not. FREE wifi in the lobby- I used it several times with no problems whatsoever. They provide FREE wired internet connection in the rooms. We used with no problems. They provide TWO computers off of the lobby so you can print your boarding passes- for FREE! They have a FREE airport shuttle and don’t make you leave 2 hours earlier than you need to- If you want to spend more on a higher ranked room- your choice- “Hampton Inn Downtown San Diego” had everything we needed- and more!

Reviews.Title: “A "best-value" for all of downtown San Diego. Close to Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: auklazer
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite "best-value" hotels for San Diego. Let's face it, San Diego hotel prices for downtown can be hard on the expense account. But the Hampton Inn, on Pacific Coast Hwy, (walking distance to Little Italy and the Gas Lamp District), always seems to maintain the best price for the location in town. Very safe underground and well lit parking garage, too. Very clean rooms and an airy and open lobby and breakfast spot. Great folks at the front desk, as well.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: bonnierph
Reviews.Content: This Hampton is clean and spacious with courteous staff as most Hamptons are, but this hotel is unique because it sits right next to the train tracks with trains constantly coming by and BLARING their horns. This is the only hotel I have ever stayed in that provides ear plugs in each room for their guests. That should tell you something right there! The on site parking garage has spaces that are SO narrow, you have to fold in your mirrors to fit your car in the space. If you are not back to the hotel by around 7pm, you will not find parking and the aisles are so narrow that you cannot turn around to come back down to the exit. The only way down, if you are not lucky enough to find a spot, is to back down the ramps, as there is no room to maneuver turning around. People make up their own spaces against the walls, making it even harder to navigate the garage. One night, 2 cars literally parked in front of the elevators! I always try to stay at a Hampton, as they are reliable, but I definitely do not recommend this particular one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Muriel4_12
Reviews.Content: It took me more than an hour to pick out where we would stay in San Diego. This was our first trip there, and I wanted to be centrally located. This hotel chain is one we trust for consistent cleanliness and quality. I was a little concerned about noise with being close to the airport and trains. While we did hear trains in the evening in the room, we didn't hear anything during the night while we were sleeping. I did not hear any airplanes. There is underground parking at this location with in and out privileges. There is a charge of $12.00 per day as I write this review. When we left I realized that I had forgotten my ipod in the room. I phoned from Yuma and the hotel personnel located it where I had left it plugged in in the bathroom and returned it to me by Fedex ( at my expense of course). We enjoyed our stay here. We were 5 minutes, on foot, from Little Italy, 20 minutes from the Gaslamp district, 3 minutes from the embarcadero, the trolley tour stop and the maritime museum. We were able to go out early and pick up the city tour at 9:15 a.m. just one block down on the waterfront. There is a wide pedestrian walkway all along the harbour and you can tour the aircraft carrier, the Midway, moored there. Further along we enjoyed a coffee at Seaport Village.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGBG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. The hotel is close to the airport and has their own transit bus. The hotel has large and clean rooms. There are free WIFI, but not wireless. The wireless WIFI is only i the reception. The breakfast is basic. There are some fastfood restaurants in walking distance. If ypu want to have a room for a night, close to the airport - the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nicolej117
Reviews.Content: First off, yes the train is loud! It is very close. I knew about this ahead of time though so I brought my own ear plugs. They do provide ear plugs anyway. I'm used to sleeping with ear plugs so it was no problem for me. However, the person I stayed with did not use ear plugs and had trouble sleeping. The Hampton was fairly basic. You get what you pay for. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast is of a decent variety and free. The best part about the Hampton Inn is definetly the location. It's walking distance to little Italy and the pier, USS Midway and a bit of a hike or an easy $8 cab ride to either the Gaslamp Quarter or Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Train and Train Crossing makes it IMPOSSIBLE to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: JLL94117
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Diamond member and the experience at this hotel has made me consider changing to another chain completely! I have lost all confidence in Hilton. My party and I (4 rooms rented) specifically asked about the train noise and we were lied to by the front desk person. She told us that the trains stopped at 11pm and didn't begin again until 6am. She neglected to tell us that the trains run until nearly midnight AND a HUGE freight train comes through at 4:15AM!!! Then, the trains started again at 5:15AM. I showered and departed the hotel 2.5 hours before I needed to because I couldn't stand the train and bell noise! Horrible experience and I caution all except the totally deaf to stay away from this property. As a train station it's fine, but as a place you're supposed to sleep it's a joke. Shame on you Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and poor service”
Reviews.Author: comfytravel
Reviews.Content: We had to stay for the New Year night - the prices for other hotels for that night were astronomical. This one was affordable for a number of reasons. It is close to railroad, but what is even worse, is the soundproofing between the room. Actually, this is a problem in all Hampton Inns where we stayed. The receptionist was arrogant and plain rude, which is very rare in South California. Parking is awfully tight, and they allow big trucks there. Location is close to downtown, but it appears that it used to be quite seedy, and it still feels that way.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: Thinker_to_go
Reviews.Content: As Hampton Inns go, I'd say this one is below average. The LOCATION is the best thing going for it, but the look and feel leaves something to be desired. The staff was friendly, the breakfast is the same you get at any other Hampton Inn. Probably the biggest drawback was the train going by loudly once in a while (at any time, day or night). The TV channel selection sucked, no fridge or microwave (should have asked, apparently), and shower pressure was weak. Ok for the price and suitable for business travel, but if you are here on vacation, splurge and upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: dwlawson
Reviews.Content: Too close to the train and trolley tracks, VERY noisy. For the price, would have expected better. Had to REQUEST a microwave and frig. Shower door was very unstable. The people were nice, but still, for the price, it was not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieKTustin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a strategic location! Thanks to tripadvisor reviewers about the train noise. I found that it was not that bad. I asked for a room closer to the front. Hotel also provided ear plugs which I used and it worked. Only Amtrak trains that passed by occasionally made a noise. The San Diego Trolley (MTS, I don't know why it is called a trolley since it is a tram) does not make that much noise. There are more positive sides about this hotel than the negative(noise). The location is so great. I didn't want to drive all over SD so we used the MTS trolley to Seaport Village, Gaslamp Quarter, etc. by paying $5 per person, a day pass. This tram goes to Old Town also. It was awesome! There is also Old Town Trolley for about $30 per day where they take you places, more like a tour and narration by the driver than a transportation. This trolley stop is close to the hotel. But we didn't take that. We will consider that when we go with out-of-state guests. The hotel bed was great and comfy. I slept really good. I didn't hear any noise from neighbors. I felt like we were the only one was here but when we went down for breakfast there were a lot of people. It was quiet. Everything is clean, modern, and professional. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was good. Good coffee, tea, bagel, English muffin, muffins, oatmeal, cereal, juice, yogurt, hot waffle, hot biscuits, scramble eggs, gravy, danish, etc. Extensive variety for a continental breakfast. Hotel provides a shuttle. So if you don't have a car and travel by Amtrak or train, you don't need to rent a car. The MTS trolley station is behind the hotel. The Amtrak station is within a walking distance. You can call the hotel to pick you up from the station or the airport (also nearby). Little Italy is within a walking distance and had a yummy Italian lunch there. Star of India and US Midway is within a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonable priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: Not much for providing reviews, but had a great experience at the Hampton Inn in downtown San Diego. Hotel location is awesome. Walk to boats, aircraft carrier (Midway), Little Italy, Amtrak, and the tram. Used tram to get to Old Town in just 5 mins. Staff was great. Everyone there. Every interaction with staff was good. Hotel was elegant. Room was great. Breakfast was well presented and good. Only issue for me were the parking fees ($12/night) which annoys me. Also, some may find the train tracks nearby distracting because of the train horns. I was fine with it. A/C muffled any noise that mattered.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple stays and I'll keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Becky L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hampton Inns all across the US, and I stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego downtown on two separate occasions - in October 2011 for business and back in July 2008 for Comic Con. Both stays were fantastic! In July 08 they accommodated us at the last minute when our flight home was cancelled. I was so impressed that I chose them again for my week-long business stay in Oct 11. The front desk were always friendly and courteous, and they gave my friends and I great advice on restaurants and bars in the area. It's an easy, safe walk to Little Italy with a great night life scene. The beds are comfortable, rooms are always clean and smell nice, and they gave me fresh towels every day. The iron in my room worked well (important on a business trip) and I couldn't hear my neighbors at all, even though the hotel was obviously pretty full. Each time I've stayed here I've had a corner room with a HUGE bathroom. I'm not sure what the other rooms are like. Most other reviewers seem to comment on the train, so I will as well. It has never bothered me at this Hampton Inn. I'm not a particularly light sleeper, but not all that deep of a sleeper when away from home, and the train never woke me. If you're worried, request a room in the front of the hotel before you arrive. No matter where you stay downtown, you're likely to hear the train, and I wouldn't let that deter you from this hotel in particular. The breakfast spread was typical for Hampton Inn with a hot option, like eggs and sausage, or make-your-own breakfast sandwiches with egg and sausage or bacon, and some days they had biscuits and gravy. Plus they had breakfast items you'll find anywhere - cold and hot cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, muffins, waffles. I'm a coffee snob, and their coffee was always fresh and delicious. It's obvious they clean the urns. So to sum up: Clean, friendly, good breakfast, good coffee, would stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “close to attractions, very nice”
Reviews.Author: cumbo
Reviews.Content: As an overseas I found it very handy to all attractions including the USS Enterprise as well as the cruise ships. It's an easy walk to downtown and a tram ride to the convention centre and even Mexico! The trains are noisy though but our room at the front was ok. The breakfast was good except for the polystyrene plates and cups and plastic utensils, such a lot of pollution. We love staying at Hampton Inns but why can't someone in management take charge and implement china plates and bowls and real cutlery, it must be better for the environment and they should set the example. Otherwise, nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel the Hampton way but no wifi in rooms”
Reviews.Author: gladysdv1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean as would any Hampton. The rooms were well equipped but has no wifi. We were given a room by the railroad so it was quite noisy. Breakfast was crowded. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: CincyTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers stated, the train noise at the hotel is annoying. The trains and trolleys go through the area behind the hotel with loud horn blowing until 11 or 12 pm and start up again at 6 am. If you can stand that point, the hotel is inexpensive and has an excellent location. The staff members we dealt with were very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is walking distance to the maritime museum and waterfront attractions. Is is also walking distance to Little Italy--which has some of the city's best value restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Short Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lookinforadventure
Reviews.Content: Chose the Hampton Inn for it's location (one block from harbor), value (using AARP discount), free airport shuttle (airport is under construction so I'm glad we didn't have to manuver a car there!) and continental breakfast (which was very adequate!!). Everything about the place was perfect - except for the train noise which seems to be the only big complaint from anyone. But considering the location and the value we could easily overlook the noise. Their shuttle would have taken us to other sites (zoo, Balboa park etc) but there was plenty to do right there within walking distance. You are only a block away from the harbor (I could see the Star of India out of my window - awesome : D ) There is also a train (tram) system in the city which was easily accessible to get to other places. All in all, it was the perfect spot, time of year and value - we will definately stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beware of train noise!”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: I only got to spend one short night at the Hampton, but I was really impressed. The hotel feels pretty new, and the staff was great. By comparison, I stayed at the W just a couple of blocks away for two nights, and though this hotel was both better and a better value. Being a bit of a train buff, I asked for a room near the tracks. Front desk thought I was nuts, but happily accomodated. The room included ear plugs and a noise machine for those who don't like train noise. The front desk was also very helpful in recommending an area to go jogging (running along the harbor was great), and recommending a great little mexican taco restaurant next door. Rooms were very nice. Internet was free and pretty fast. The complimentary ride to the airport was nice and the gentleman driver was very friendly. The trip to the terminal was less than 10 minutes. Only concern, as others have said, is there is a busy train line right behind the hotel. The crossing nearby has a bell sound that could get annoying, and the tracks are busy until after 1:00 am and start up again a little after 4:00 am. If you are a light sleeper, request a room away from the tracks and the crossing. One advantage of the rail line is that there is a trolley station literaly right behind the hotel. This makes it very easy to get around San Diego. I would definately stay here again if I was in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: humboldtraveler
Reviews.Content: A great check in, staff was excellent. The one gentleman will go far in the hotel industry. They remembered my name and greeted me when ever I came thru. All the staff thru out the hotel was so polite, it was refreshing. Clean rooms, yes it is a bit noisey, but I stayed at the Hyatt last time, and it was almost as noisey with the trains etc. excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from a week at the Hampton inn and had a fabulous time. we had a room at the front of the hotel, it was clean and certainly big enough for us. the bathroom was spotless. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and went out of their way to help us find our way around the city. most of the stuff we wanted to see was a short walk away- the Midway was well worth a visit. The hotel has a shuttle bus which will take you anywhere in downtown san diego between 6am and 10 pm- just ask! the noise from the trains stopped at 11pm and restarted at 6am. so that wasnt a problem, nor was traffic noise a problem, but then I am used to London traffic and we found the traffic in san Diego to be very quiet, certainly on a par with London at 2am! overall, good value for money and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: SVG108
Reviews.Content: Given that I stayed only for 1 night while on a business trip...I don't think there was anything special about this hotel. parking is $12 per night and the basement spots are really tight! The really annoying things are trains that pass by at night (with loud horns)

Reviews.Title: “Not up to brand's standards”
Reviews.Author: Mrsmickeymac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not at all what you would expect from a Hampton Inn. I will save a lot of the details of how this place is not - as the hotel claims it is under new management. But, if you want train noise all night long, and bad cs, this joint is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Angham A
Reviews.Content: I had a long day... and my day didn't want to end. But, finally I arrived to the Hampton Inn on 1531 Pacific Highway in san Diego. I was so glad to finally drop my luggage and feel comfortable, but my experience only got better when Dan Venable, who was at the lobby desk, greeted me and made my stay much better than I anticipated. It is those employees, who have pride in what they do that make all the difference in other peoples' lives. Thank you Mr. Venable. I will sure come back again and recommend your location to my friends and family memebers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cdallman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location. Staff is efficient and friendly. We were surpirsed by the train tracks that are directly behind the hotel. We would not stay her again just because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great as long as you don't mind train noise”
Reviews.Author: booksopenminds
Reviews.Content: You know that there might be something wrong when you find ear plugs & a noise machine by the bed... the train is very close & quite loud. Luckily, apparently we sleep like bricks because while we heard the trains a lot during the day, they did not wake us at night. The location is great- very easy to walk to the waterfront & the New Children's Museum. Their parking garage is not the best- very skinny spaces that most people seemed to have a very hard time maneuvering into. They do have a free shuttle to the zoo that leaves at 10am and picks you up at 4pm- this is nice, but the zoo has free parking so we just drove over (under 10 min away). The breakfast was good & the staff was friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “I Should've Slept On The Railroad Tracks In The Back..”
Reviews.Author: richnanners
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival to the hotel for my scheduled reservation I was told to wait for 45 minutes (3pm).I should've recognized this as a sign of things to come. I am a "Hilton Honors Diamond Member" & this never occurs. I then left to go around the corner to "Little Italy" for a bite to eat. A great atmosphere to simply walk around. Upon finally checking in my room was still not available. I was eventually checked by the staff. The person checking put my in room#401 said this was a room near the front of the hotel & away from the train tracks that run directly behind the hotel. I said "O.K." and went to my room & attempted to settle in for the night. Walking in the hallway from the elevator you get a great smoky odor of "Stale Cigarettes" & faded carpet to feel like you are in a casino in "Las Vegas". The plus about the hotel it has a great walk of a block to the San Diego Bay. It makes you feel refreshed & a great for people watching. A great way to clear your mind & forget about any problems that you or the Earth may have. But, when I went back to my room. I felt "Vertigo" as soon as I walked in the room. I constantly felt the floor rumbling from the train that consistantly rumbled by. I could hear he train in the distance from my room. But, I could also hear the parade of traffic passing in front of my hotel. I almost felt like I was sleeping under a "freeway under pass". Even though I had ear plugs, I could still hear my surroundings. I had a restless night of sleep consistantly feeling if an actual earthquake was occuring. I left 2 hours early for work to get away from here. I didn't bother having the free breakfast, due to the fact I did not want to get any more motion sickness. I know next time I come to San Diego, I will not be coming here...

Reviews.Title: “nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: luckiestme22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego-Downtown for a night and was overall happy with the property. Friendly service, pretty good breakfast buffet and clean rooms. My only gripe was the train passing at all times of the night / early morning, and the bell / alarm going off each time. It was LOUD and felt like it would come by every 10 minutes. Aside from that, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for Airport & Cruise Terminal”
Reviews.Author: ubl666
Reviews.Content: Hotel very convenient for airport and cruise terminal and provides complementary transport shuttle. Staff very friendly and hotel very modern and clean; although they had suffered a flood and the gym was out of order; however alternative arrangements had been made to use facility in another hotel. We asked for a refridgerator for our room and was brought one promptly but it had no been cleaned out and there were the remains of someone elses food going mouldy - this was avoidable if the staff had checked properly. Rooms very large and comfortable with good views of aircraft landing at nearby airport. HJotel placed well as a base for sight seeing. There was far too much plastic at the complimentary breakfast which cheapens the whole experience; wheras I like to see and use traditional knifes, forks and plates.

Reviews.Title: “Served Function Very Well”
Reviews.Author: DougNichols
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and ideally situated. I am a novice to San Diego so for me, it was very suitable for getting my feet wet with the city. I had a very good stay – somewhat short – but pleasant. I have no complaints. It is located in the middle of a lot of activity (first time in San Diego – so I can’t say it was in the middle of everything). The staff was very friendly and when I asked what was there to do – well - all I got in return was a great deal of friendly and helpful advice delivered with smile, something that seems rarer and rarer. In the past I was solid Choice Privileges member (12 years with 5 years elite diamond) and the first time at a Hampton Inn, the treatment overshadows what I received from Choice. SO - If you have a rewards card, sign me up – I am hooked and a frequent traveler (guest or customer however you wish to label me).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EvilHomerBoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently. Hotel is approx 20-30 mins walk to Gaslamp Quarter but overlooking the bay opposite the maritime museum (a lovely sail boat). Rooms are clean and well maintained with coffee making facilities and daily maid service. Continental breakfast was included as was a shuttle service to the airport. Staff extremely friendly and willing to help out. Nice pool and mini gym. Would definitely recommend to others. Would be even better if it had a bar!

Reviews.Title: “it was just ok”
Reviews.Author: theresa p
Reviews.Content: I didnt like the bathroom i had it was just a shower with no tub and the water went everywhere making it very dangerous to walk around in there after my shower. It also had a smell of ammonia, very strong. staff was nice but the noise from train was just to much.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown SD, Gorgeous bay views Great Price, Free breakfast, So what the trolley is close?”
Reviews.Author: TheresaFreckles
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great experience. There is a free breakfast daily and a free airport shuttle. The rooms (beds, bathrooms) are spotless. The bed is comfy. I have no complaints. Plenty of towels and pillows. Friendly staff. The USS Midway is practically across the street. Yes, the trolley runs behind the hotel... But, hello!!! You are traveling to downtown San Diego. This is part of the experience. I slept like a baby. If you are traveling to a city, you are gonna here noise. I think the people who are complaining about the trolley should vacation in a cornfield next time. I used the fitness center and the pool daily and I was happy with both. The hotel is in the middle of Little Italy. Awesome food! We used the trolley to go everywhere and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Only problem is the ugly view right next to the dumpster.”
Reviews.Author: LLSoCali
Reviews.Content: Yes we are so close to the ocean, but didn't get at least a decent view. We got the dumpster view with pooping pigeons to go with it. Haha. Anyways, it doesn't matter because most of the time are spent outside. Located near Little Italy, next to the train which is super convenient, walking distance to the beach, but a bit of the walking to the Gaslamp District if you're willing to walk a lot to explore. The train isn't that noisy for us, comfortable beds, and pretty good, free breakfast (the one where you wait to make your waffles).

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and we will be back for more!”
Reviews.Author: boyerja
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn has the ideal location right next to the harbor and easy access to San Diego's historic museums, shopping centers, and only a few blocks from Little Italy! The staff is incredibly friendsly and the beds were sent from heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service - a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Semi-retiredOntario
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn - Downtown in San Diego is an excellent value. The hotel is conveniently located close to the waterfront (great view of the sunset), and only a few blocks from the Little Italy restaurants. The rooms are spacious, clean and well cared for. All staff are friendly and helpful, but Jennifer and her male colleague on the front desk treated us like we were special guests. They took care of our special room request and gave us advice about sightseeing and dining. Breakfast is included with the price, and the selections were varied each day. A free shuttle was available to take us to Balboa Park, the Sand Diego Zoo and to shopping in the Gaslamp area. Yes, the commuter train track is right behind the hotel, but we always travel with a "white noise" machine, and slept without any problem. The hotel is located on the Pacific Highway - a major thoroughfare, so there is some traffic noise and sirens at times. All hotels in the area would have the same situation (train noise and sirens). A great place to stay, with superb service!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel walking distance to many San Diego areas”
Reviews.Author: Ozstars
Reviews.Content: We have just left Hampton Inn Downtown after 5 night stay and other than a hiccup at checkout ( could not find paperwork that showed we had prepaid room so going to be charged again) our visit was great. This hotel has the friendliest staff - Nate on front desk as well as another lovely lady who caught up with us at end of each day to see how we were going. Hotel is walking distance to waterfront, Little Italy, Seaport and Gaslamp Quarter. Hotel shuttle can be booked for airport transfers and zoo. All free - Chuck the driver is such a lovely guy and very friendly. Hot breakfast every morning - range of cold and hot food (loved being able to make own waffles!) 24hr coffee in breakfast area (with hazelnut or French vanilla flavored milk) and microwave available once breakfast over. Chocolate chip cookies are served on front desk each afternoon. Train noise as stated in previous reviews is noticeable but you do get used to it and ear plugs provided. To be honest we were so busy walking and seeing San Diego that we were very tired by time we got to bed anyway. Great choice of restaurants nearby - try Petrini's for great Italian at very reasonable prices and fantastic service. This hotel offers a personalized service to its guests with reasonable rates and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Service is more Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: FannyIllinois
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the pacific Highway right next to San Diego Zoo. I covered Little Italy and SeaPort Village wit the Zoo all by walking.The staff is very friendly.They helped me carry my luggage and always wore a smile. The sound of the train was so old world charming and if you can get a good deal , what more to expect for a grand vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: ETontheroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very friendly and efficient. You may need to use some earplugs since the train crossing is behind the Hotel. Walking distance to little italy and the gas lamp is less then a mile away. The parking is very very crazy, small not well marked spots and it is easy to get turned around the wrong way in the lot. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Penny”
Reviews.Author: OilermanandTulip
Reviews.Content: Penny is the front desk supervisor, and is a very curt woman. Reminds me of a drill sergeant. Otherwise the room was okay and the room service was okay. Jennifer (front desk) was amazing!! Older, tall, slim, van driver was also fantastic. Slightly above average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location within Walking Distance of Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: OrngJuz376
Reviews.Content: I decided to write a review because I thought the previous reviews were a bit harsh on the Hampton Inn Downtown. I, too, read about the train noise. I did not receive ear plugs on my nightstand nor did I need them. During the week, (I was here for business) the train stops running around 11pm. Before that, it is a bit noisy and takes a little getting used to. I guess if you're a light sleeper you should find another place to stay. The train noise didn't start again until sometime between 4am-5am the following morning. I slept peacefully through the evening and actually got used to the "train noises" after the first night. As for the train - it's not like this is the only hotel that is affected by the train. It runs through downtown so most of the hotels in the little Italy area and various hotels thoughout the downtown area will hear the train noise. My friend actually lives several blocks up from the train and can still hear it so I'm not sure how easy it is to escape the noise. As for homeless people wandering into the hotel - that's ridiculous. I felt completely safe throughout my entire stay including walking to and from the hotel through various parts of town. It's a big city - there are always pockets of not-so-nice. The lobby doors are locked throughout the evening and you can only access with a key card. The parking is somewhat limited. I never had a problem, but I was only there during the week. If I would have had a problem - the front desk personnel were extremely helpful and I'm sure would have found alternate parking. There's plenty of street parking that is free after 6pm if you end up having to wait a bit. The front desk people were extremely kind throughout my stay. They helped me look up information about my rental car, provided info on where my guests could park, and gave area restaurant recommendations. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It's conveniently located next to Little Italy, the Beach, and is even within walking distance to the Gas Lamp Quarter. They even have a pool that faces the ocean so there were some pretty nice sunsets (I even saw someone have pizza ordered to the pool). The rooms were very clean and I didn't have any problems with my stay. People should remember this is a Hampton Inn not the big fancy Hilton in the Gas Lamp Quarter. If you want something big, fancy and expensive go stay somewhere else downtown. This was a resonably priced Hampton Inn that served all my needs, had a kind staff, and was in a location that was within walking distance to several of the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Service goes above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Mallard09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the busy San Diego Comic Con week. The hotel has a free airport shuttle that is incredibly prompt. The gentleman who drives the van is exceptionally friendly and I must say that he went above and beyond on the trip. He gave us a ride to the mall, helped us with our bags (since our flight left past check out time) and overall was there to do whatever you required to have a pleasant stay. The front desk employees were also very friendly and helpful as well. The room is nice, with my only critique that there is a shower but no tub. Other than that, very clean and spacious. There is a free breakfast in the morning which offers great value and lots of great restaurants near the hotel. The major criticism of this hotel is the train noise, which has been referenced in other reviews. It is incredibly loud - much louder than you would expect - and is pretty constant. Anyone staying here should be prepared for this. We were prepared so we just ended up laughing like crazy when we heard it because it was so ridiculously loud! Overall great stay - would probably stay closer to the convention center if we went back, in hopes of escaping the train noise!

Reviews.Title: “Noise is not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: AkamaiLynn
Reviews.Content: There are earplugs on your nightstand which should be your first clue that noise is a factor. The train/trolley tracks are on the backside of the property. The good news is you can walk to restaurants and the location is good for visiting SeaWorld. The parking is scarce and is underground. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: TRavlerbarry
Reviews.Content: I took the reviews of the train noise with a grain of salt, how wrong I was. I stayed in room 649 toward the front of the hotel. It was off a courtyard. The train noise was endless. It seemed that every 15 minutes a train would go by, blasting its horn, made worst with the echo of the courtyard. The reviews earlier had the manager stating that there was to be a "Quiet Zone" the first quarter of 2011. Well its July 2011 and there is no quiet. Another big problem is the parking. I came back from an evening out and could not find a place to park. I did find one, but the next evening the same thing. I had to park on the street for 2 hours before a spot opened. When I left on Sunday, my car was unmoveable becasue of 2 cars parked so close I could not get into my car. As the front desk does not inquire about licence numbers, they had no way to know who was parked next to my car. I had to wait 3 hours before i could leave. Thank goodness I didnt have a plane to catch. Also on Sunday morning, every spot was filled including handicap and even parking in front of stairs and elevators. I could not go up stairs as they were blocked, a ever unsafe pratice. San Diego as most large cities has a large homeless population. While sitting in the lobby awaiting friends to pick me up, 2 homeless people came into the lobby and went to the breakfast area and got water. No one at the front desk asked them what they were doing. Made me feel aliitle unsafe. I wouldn't pick the hotel again. I asked about the "Satifaction Guarteened" sign at the fron desk. The desk clerk seemed unsure what I was talking about. I just wanted to leave quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Julieabc21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an ok place, the location was excellent. The staff was so helpful which made the stay very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Springfield03
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was not one of the better Hampton Inns I have stayed in, the location to downtown San Diego was great and there was transportation from the airport. I used public transportation & the trolley stop was located right behind the hotel. The down side of that was that there was noise from the trolley & train, but wasn't that noticeable at night. Breakfast was OK, again not as good as other Hampton Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: Yes it's near train tracks however most of the hotels are along the train tracks. And the noise wasn't that bad. The rooms were exceptionally clean and spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. Free shuttle service to local attractions. Walking distance to City Centre. Best free breakfast selection of our entire holiday of USA, Mexico and Canada. Convenient secure parking available. Will stay here on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but noisy trains”
Reviews.Author: ResenarSverige
Reviews.Content: Good location and friendly staff. Close to attractions downtown and seaside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel except for the trains”
Reviews.Author: dkgunte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights a couple of weeks ago. Too bad I didn't check reviews until it was too late. Overall the hotel was nice, and easy to find. Quite a few places are within walking distance, and everything else is just a few minute drive. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing we noticed initially that first night were all the trains that go by. They don't just go by, they blow their horns as they are passing through the city. This happened each night until around 11pm or so. I guess after that time they have to be "quiet." It would then start up again around 6-7am. Our second night there we had someone above us letting their kids, from what we could tell, jump off the beds onto the floor and run around. The night management put a quick halt to that, which was nice. They even offered to move us to another room on the other side of the hotel away from the tracks. We only had one night left so instead of packing twice we decided to stay. At breakfast there was a decent selection: waffles, some type of egg, sausage, muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, fruit and yogurt. You could definitely fill up before heading out. The pool, which is on the 2nd level was fairly small. They advertise "heated", but it did not feel like it was when we were there. As I said before the hotel and staff were great. The only thing that drops the rating for me is the train noise.

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessary charges and high pre-charged incidental fees”
Reviews.Author: NC_Traveller_50
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel on Sunday and, as with most hotels, I was asked for my id and a credit card (for incidentals). Never was it mentioned that they were going to go ahead and charge the full stay immediately along with a $50 per night incidental fee. My stay was five nights. My VISA debit card was hit for $899 for the room and $250 for incidentals, but because I was not intending to settle my room charges fully against this payment type I didn't have almost $1200 extra in this account. So the hotel charged (or let me say authorized against my card) $600 the first night and then $189 the second night and then $117 (I think) the third night) and then when I checked out they wanted my payment becasue all they had done was run "holds" authorizing the payments. Becasue this is a debit chard once something is authorized against it you no longer have the ability to spend it. How do you think they thought I was going to eat while I was there ... taking hundreds of dollars more than my stay was going to cost. This should be illegal!!!! I will never stay at a Hampton Inn again and I will advise all I come in contact with to avoid Hampton like the plague. It should also be noted that this hotel lists as one of its pros that it is one block from the trolley ... it is right on the railroad track and trolley track so you have trains blowing horns ALLLLLLL night long. Also, the homeless mission adjoins the hotel on one side so if you decide to take the trolley as your form of transportation you can expect to see many homeless, especially in the morning, and get begged for money while you wait for your ride.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton hospitality, but unfortunate choo-choo”
Reviews.Author: MrsDHS
Reviews.Content: From the start, the service was outstanding! Truly the Hilton family welcome. Thought I could handle the train all night, but didn't sleep a wink. However, they went out of their way to compensate me and switched my room. As usual, the beds were soft and cozy, rooms clean and sufficient. Would have liked a mini-frig and microwave, but learned that all you have to do is ask for them. Location is ideal, walking distance to harbor activities and Anthony's. Complimentary breakfast was awesome. 24/7 Coffee bar---excellent! Worst thing: parking garage---horrendous! An accident waiting to happen. Hard to get into a space and worse getting out. After dark, there's not enough spaces to accomodate the guests. However, the staff come down and help us park.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Hampton quality, but right next to a train track”
Reviews.Author: Marblehead750
Reviews.Content: When I checked into my room, I noticed two things I had never seen before in a hotel room: two sets of ear plugs on the bedside table and a white noise machine. I wondered why for only a few minutes when a train horn blast rattled the window. Peering out the window, there is a train track that runs right behind the hotel and goes by every 15 min or so during the day (up until about 11pm and then starts again at 6am). If train noise bothers you, then stay elsewhere. The electric trolley which runs on parallel tracks, however, is much less noisy and is convenient for getting to the Gaslight district. The room and breakfast were of usual Hampton quality. Parking was underneath the hotel and cost $12 per day, which is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “stAff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VeroLovesFonzy
Reviews.Content: everything was great except my kids were cut on their feet from the swimming pool. otherwise it was very relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but LOUD!!”
Reviews.Author: Dlbbailey
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and prefer Hampton Inn and Hilton Garden Inn. Great amenities for the price. This location was consistent with my expectations, except the train noise cannot be ignored. There are sound abatement options this hotel should consider. I don't know if I'd stay again. The staff was very nice, though.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really Loud”
Reviews.Author: Calicakes
Reviews.Content: Wow, I'd read the reviews after I prepaid, so I was stuck. Those ppl were not kidding when they said it was loud. The train goes by so many times during the day. Wow, very loud. I asked for a room away from the train, but when I got to my room( room 545), I looked out the window and there was the train. The pool was really dirty too. Other than that, the room was fine, the bed was comfortable, the staff was great and the location was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “We're here now... could not be better!”
Reviews.Author: skrwalker
Reviews.Content: We're here now and we've been so pleased with everything from the service, cleanliness and location. The staff is MORE than helpful. Not only do they provided free shuttle service to and from the zoo, but they'll pick you up (and return you) at the airport and if not too busy, drop you in the gaslamp or surrounding areas. We have not had any problems with the train at night... I believe the new quiet hours have taken effect. Perfect walking distance to midway area, seaport village (shopping/dining)... a great lunch spot is The Fish Market just past the Midway Museum. Don't hesitate booking this hotel for your trip. If you'd like to save a few bucks on cab fair, it never hurts to ask if the shuttle is available!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: Wigdog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times. One could not ask for a more accommodating staff! They are so helpful and friendly. The location is great as you can travel anywhere around the area with various forms of transportation available and walking is definitely NOT out of the question. I took 14 high school seniors with me and we walked everywhere around this location. Honestly, I can not say enough about the hotel; it was great. The one and ONLY downfall is DO NOT get a room on the train side. I am use to trains and it did not bother me as much as others in our group. I did ask not to be located on the train side and several of our rooms were (mine included):). Any other questions feel free to email me kwiggins@gcusd.com.

Reviews.Title: “Trains are LOUD”
Reviews.Author: terps1962
Reviews.Content: I stayed on night. Reading all the reviews, I was prepared for the train noise, so there were no surprises. I was in town a day early for a conference and I needed one more stay to get back to Diamond level, so I picked this hotel. The rate was fine and the people working at the hotel were great. The van driver took me downtown in the morning. Very nice gentleman. I just want to again warn people of the noise. It is a shame the hotel is located where it is. My room was the back corner, so there was no escaping the noise. I can't say if rooms in the front of the hotel and better. I arrived after 11pm and the noise (horns, bells) was constant. The hotel provides ear plug on the night stand. With the ear plugs, I was able to get a peaceful sleep. My only problem was that sleeping with ear plugs is not that comfortable, especially when trying to sleep on one's side. Again, I knew what I was getting into before I stayed here. The staff was great. Just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norrlandska
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here both during business trips and in private and this hotel is perfect either way! Staaf is skilled and polite, rooms are nice, free internet, complementory breakfast and nearby the sea, trolleys, buses and walking distance to Gaslamp District. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: traveldamsel
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems very, very old and is not a good representation of what I am used to finding in a Hampton Inn. We just stayed one night and weren't in the room too much since we were out sight seeing but if I had to spend more time in this hotel I wouldn't have been happy. Because the hotel is old it doesn't have a clean feel to it. The room we were in also seemed very crowded, like all the furniture in the room didn't fit too well. Our room was near the area where the vending machine was located and just around the corner from the elevator so all night we heard people coming and going. The hotel is also close to two trolley stops so all night we could hear the trolley bell, which didn't allow us to sleep too well. The elevator is also hidden when you walk in the hotel. We couldn't find it and it turned out that it was down a hall and in a place where you wouldn't expect it to be. The eating area was also very crowded and busy during breakfast. The good thing about this hotel is that it is not far from the harbor, the airport, and Little Italy. They also offer free shuttle service and they drove us to the Gaslamp District and to the airport and both drivers were very nice. The guy at the front desk who arranged our shuttle service was very nice too. Of course they offer free breakfast, too, which is good. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning on staying for a night or two and won't be spending too much time in your room, and if you are a heavy sleeper. Hopefully they will remodel and update this hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Trains”
Reviews.Author: C0nfussed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn from March 17-20. We were in Rm 318, right at the back of the building next to the tracks. It was quite loud but we are pretty deep sleepers and it only woke us once. Ear plugs were complimentary but we didn't think it was that necessary. I found the noise more annoying during the day, but maybe it was because I was sick and the trains go by more frequently during the day. The beds were very comfortable. One thing that didn't float my boat was the vinyl wallpaper in the shower/tub. It really smelled like cheap plastic and it was a bit strong. It looked new so it could have just been that new plastic smell... Otherwise, it was a clean and comfortable hotel. The breakfast was OK. If you're the eggs and bacon type of person you'll be disappointed but the waffles made it worthwhile. A plus: The hotel provides a shuttle to the zoo and back (10am-4pm). We chose this hotel because we wanted to do a lot of city exploring and it was close to the downtown core and the transit.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared... the train is VERY loud”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoer89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, a very nice Hampton Inn that you would expect anywhere in the country. It is about a one mile very pleasant walk to the Gaslamp or harbor shopping area. These are the big pluses. However, there are train track literally adjacent to the hotel...freight train, local trolley, and it can be loud, incredibly loud. There is even the occasional train that rumble through at 3 AM and you are going to wake up. It is a nice property in a great city, but the proximity to the train tracks just makes it a no go for me next time in the city. If you are a Hilton fan... there is a full service Hilton and an Embassy Suites (although this also looks very near the tracks). I read the reviews before choosing the Hampton and didn't believe the trains could be such an issue, well, they are.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel if you are looking to be around a certain area of town”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAzJoni
Reviews.Content: We went for our anniversary Jan 28 & Jan 29 2011 The hotel is in the old part of town,you can walk across the street to see the old ships.And cruise ships it is a nice ambiance.Not far is the old navy ship that is a museum now. They do give you ear plugs for your ears.The trains do go by at night.They are doing construction now to update but this is only temporary. The breakfast was good,they have two hot entree's eggs and they had sausage one day and a diffrent one the next day.plus coffee,variety juice,breads, rolls, danish,fruits,hard boil eggs,cereal and etc.There is no restaurant in the Hotel. Breakfast in one of there meeting rooms.It is kept clean.The rooms were nice and comfortable.Then that night we walked to Little Italy which is only a few blocks from the hotel.All kinds of Italian restaurants and stores.We ate at Spaghettieria.It had an old look about the place since it is an old neighborhood. it was bigger then I thought it was.We had the veal parmigian and gnocchi was diffrent then I had before. for dinner and trimatsu for dessert.I had wine and my husband had coffee.The food was tasteful. We were not far from the sea port village,The had every store you can think of, and places to eat at.After eating you may want to stroll around there to walk off some of the food you ate and check out the tables where people are selling there handmade things. After that We took a ride to the gaslamp district. They had parking in the daytime cost 5.00 after 6pm it was 20.00 dollars that is when all the people party down there at night.You could not count all the restaurants and bars and stores they have down there so many.They had The restaurant and bar Jim Croce which was a singer.But we went to this restaurant called( Dick's) It was a fun place to eat.They warn you to beware of the waiters.They can be sarcastic in a fun way.there were a bunch of girls celebrating one of the girls birthday and the waiter gives them each a paper hat with a different sayings on it until they take the hat off like she is a sex machine but broken, We ate on the patio when you walk in you see a lifeguard chair there first time I seen that in a restaurant. they had a lot of room there and on the inside.If you are on a diet or watching your weight you can split something. We split a chili with out beans which was different but good,a cheeseburger with everything on it a hawiian and slaw with the good ole french fries.With a drink of Mojito which I enjoyed and my husband had coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location and most attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: DorisMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the cruise terminal...walking distance..safe and great area. The hotel is well-appointed with fresh and great breakfast choices. The staff, including Manager Sean Fitzgerald really care about their guests and go "all out' to make your stay grand. The trolley is located right behind the hotel and goes everywhere...buy a one day pass ($5.00) and hop on and off. Hotel is very close to Seaport Village with lots of stores and eateries. The train whistle, heard at back of hotel, will soon stop as new legislation has now declared the hotel in a "Quiet Zone Area"...We had a wonderful time here....shuttle service as well to Cruise Terminal and to/from airport.

Reviews.Title: “They give you earplugs for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Farrell2009
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this hotel recently and were absolutely amazed at how loud the trains actually were! I tend to think people are exaggerating in reviews, but when I arrived and was handed a set of earplugs, that said it all. Don't worry, the location makes up for everything else! When it wasn't the train blasting by, it was a screaming child that I could hear through the paper thin walls, or the jets taking off from the naval base across the bay. The shuttle service is amazing. It will take you pretty much anywhere you want to go, but doesn't go out to any of the islands. We used it as our transportation when we were staying downtown. The breakfast was terrible. I think the eggs were powdered...is that even possible? I would stay here again because you can't beat this location. It is so close to everything you would want to go to in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Sleep - Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Jbledsoe2009
Reviews.Content: Who in their right mind would build a hotel next to a set of train tracks?? Each train that passes by this hotel had to blare their horns exceeding 120dB at times! There are four train tracks that run next to this hotel - the San Diego Trolley, the San Diego Coaster (commuter train) and a major Amtrak line. Because of the multiple crossings in the downtown area, you hear the horns multiple times. There is no way around it, and earplus DO NOT help! On top of that, this hotel does NOT have pillowtop matresses that Hampton Inn is famous for, nor do the rooms have referigerators or microwave ovens. They only have wired Internet in the rooms (not wireless). The parking garage that is underneath the hotel costs $12 and you need you room key to get in and out (and it didn't work most of the time I was there). Take my advice - there are MANY hotels in the area. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience! Unprofessional, low standards, hidden charges.”
Reviews.Author: walterglover
Reviews.Content: We booked our room in advance for the ACN convention, received receipt that showed room was already paid on credit card. When checking in, desk staff was clueless with any kind of help. They charged us again another $375 and even with showing proof that the room was already paid for. Upon asking for the Manager, he just said there was nothing he could do and walked away! They said we had to talk with Corporate to try to resolve the problem. The only problem was that we had proof we already paid, but they were not budging because their "computer" didn't reflect the transaction. They drained the account and made our trip miserable! They were rude, discourteous, and clueless! The room was small with lots of furniture so you could stub your toe on everything! The TV was from back in the 80's and small! The beds were attrociously uncomfortable and woke up with backaches! It didn't matter that the trains shook the beds and the room because it was expected in that location. Oh, and their "hot breakfast"! Yikes! Put a spoonful of powdered eggs and some kind of plastic sausage in your mouth! What a eye opener! I have stayed at Hampton Inns for past 20 yrs but this one put the cherry on that cake! I WILL NEVER EVER STAY AT ANOTHER ONE, AND WILL TELL ALL MY FRIENDS AND FAMILY OF THIS HORRIBLE PLACE. And don't forget those hidden charges they don't advertise or tell you about until your wonderful stay is finally over with...$12 per day to park your car in their 2X4 garage!

Reviews.Title: “The train is a bummer, but the location is great.”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeCol
Reviews.Content: Everyone mentions the train. Well, I hope the hotel is successful in negotiating the quiet zone near its property, because the trains are a killer. However, if you use the ear plugs they leave in your room, honestly, I never heard them at night. The annoying thing was if I was on the phone or watching TV--the trains could drown out what I was trying to listen to. But on to the hotel itself. I paid for parking ($12 per day) which I guess is reasonable in San Diego. I never had a problem except when we were leaving because we had all turned in our room cards and yet we needed one to get out of the garage. I pressed the "help" button and they buzzed us out. The location was great for being there for 4 evenings. It is within walking distance of the ocean front (right at the Cruise Ship Pier) and Little Italy and other great restaurants (Indigo Grill is amazing for higher priced food, Burger Lounge is incredible for lower prices.) . Any of the Italian restaurants are recommended. Breakfast at the hotel was good. Standard Hampton Inn fare. Internet was good, but only wired in the rooms (bothered me because I like to use the Hampton p[illow desk and work while I sit in bed and I couldn't here). The reason I would come back? Nandu. Nandu works at the front desk and he is incredible. He is friendly and knowledgeable without being cloying. I would return just because he is so very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Like everyone says - the train is a killer”
Reviews.Author: kjtrdgfb
Reviews.Content: This review is identical to most on Tripadvisor. The Hampton Inn is a nice, comfortable, clean, reasonably priced hotel in downtown San Diego. It's just a few minutes from the airport and next to the trolley and convenient to everywhere. And the free breakfast is very good as well. It's also next to a well-used railroad track, When we checked in, the clerk told us that we could have a room on the west side of the hotel away from the railroad track due to my Hilton HHonors status and I was very pleased. When I got to the room, I looked out the window and there was the track just to the left. I asked the clerk about this and he said that the hotel was full and my room was the best he had when I checked in. I was happy to hear little train noise between 10 PM and 4 AM - but that 4 AM train was LOUD. And the frequency of train traffic quickly increased after that. If I had to stay in the downtown section of San Diego, I would probably consider the Hampton Inn again but I think I would look elsewhere and spend a little money on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: eSMITH100015
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Great staff, clean comfy room. Excellent variety for inclusive continental breakfast and great coffee 24 hrs. Noticed prebagged breakfasts at the front desk for people on the go. Rainy so did not use the pool or exercise rooms ( appeared good). One block from Little Italy, short 10 minute walk to cruise pier. Only 1 1/2 miles to airport and hotel shuttle available. On site parking only $6.00. Only negative would be the noise of the amtrak/trolley behind the hotel. They provided ear plugs which worked great for us. Hotel itself was not noisy. Tracks provided quick access to trolley to enable us to get to all parts of the city without renting a car. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Stlouiebaby
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel. Its right next to public transportation which we found wonderful since we didn't have a car. You do hear the trains when awake but we never heard them when we slept. We didn't have to use the earplugs that were supplied. Nandu was very friendly and helpful. The shuttle runs 6 AM to 10 PM. Maria (shuttle driver) was very helpful with information. She recommended Filiipis for the best pizza. It was the best pizza and located in Little Italy within walking distance. The shuttle has a daily schedule to the zoo for guests. It leaves at 10 am and picks up at 4 pm. Hotel was clean and housekeeping did a great job. Breakfast was good. Biscuits and gravy. Scrambled eggs with ham and cheese. Waffles. Muffins. Toast. Bagels. Etc. The dining area was clean and spacious. Plenty of tables. Jack in the Box is one block over. If you aren't overly sensitive to noise from the trains I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HAMPTON INN, RIGHT ON THE TRAIN TRACKS”
Reviews.Author: michaelhopper3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, the rooms are pretty nice, TV set's a little dated, but make sure you get a room on the front of the hotel and not the back. The price was fine. The SD trolly and AMtrack go roaring past and the train whistles never stop blowing. I was on the top floor and it made no difference, it was really loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but beware of train and constant red trolley sounds.”
Reviews.Author: Maria-Tucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed a whole week at this hotel. The hotel and service were pretty standard. The best thing of this hotel is its location: it's right across the Maritime Museum, with a Red Trolley stop right behind it, Little Italy within walking distance. We had to pay extra per day to park our car in their parking garage. The hotel lacks the basic services of laundry room and convenience store. You are allowed to do your laundry at the Marriot's Residence Inn just north of this hotel. There is a small 7-Eleven a block away, right behind the hotel. Our room did not have a mini-fridge, but when we requested one, the hotel provided it to us. About the train and trolley noise: I guess it depends on how good sleeper you are. My husband and children were fine, even without earplugs, but for me was a real challenge. Most probably we will not stay here again. If you like the area, the Marriot's Residence Inn seemed to be a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hampton Inn Standards”
Reviews.Author: viapanam
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous reviews have summed it up - the noise from the trains ruins any attempt at sleep. I found the desk staff too friendly - which meant checking in took forever since each person got asked their life story. There is no shop in the hotel for sodas or snacks. There is a 7-Eleven around the corner. Old style TV's in the room. Internet slowed down considerably at night (it is wired in the rooms). Overall, this was a disappointing property and not at all up to Hampton Inn standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, trains loud! Staff is super.”
Reviews.Author: thequeen54
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Sept. Great location, speedy airport pick-up/return. Staff is fantastic. Room was ok. Sheets were so scratchy, so if you have sensitive skin, be warned. Bathtub left much to be desired, paint peeling inside it. Breakfast was good. Would I stay again? Probably not. Train noise was a big issue for us, and I think I'd pay more to stay somewhere else. Easy access to Little Italy, lots of great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “The train was no big deal!”
Reviews.Author: kitgra
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, we read reviews and many were not good. The biggest complaint was the sound of the trains that go by. Well yes, the trains go by often and are loud at times. We experienced it just after checking in around 4pm. We were willing to be patient and give the hotel a try. The last time we heard the train was at 9pm and the first time we heard it in the morning was 6:04, just the right time to be waking up for a day full of site seeing. By the way, the train issue is not just Hampton Inn's problem but every hotel and condo in the area.
