There was also a lot of airplane noise, as the hotel is close to San Diego airport. If we visited this area of San Diegp again, we would probably stay at the Holiday Inn on the Bay, which is a couple of blocks closer to the bay and farther from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “I've always been a skeptic, but.......”
Reviews.Author: quigleyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Downtown is a great place to stay, not only for the value but the service is excellent. We are always skeptical when we read reviews and so that is why I decided that I needed to provide input on this hotel because we had a very positive experience. First of all, the hotel is a price value considering it is within walking distance to the cruise ships, restaurants, the ocean, etc etc. The rooms are very nice and well maintained. The staff is excellent. Their shuttle service is VERY accommodating and the breakfast buffet is "yummie". Not only did the staff go out of their way for us during our stay but they allowed us to store our luggage on our return from the cruise week. Our flight didn't leave San Diego until 6PM. We got off the cruise ship around 9:30 am and the hotel picked us up, stored our luggage while we toured San Diego for the day, and then drove us to the airport. We were very impressed and will DEFINITELY stay there again when we return to San Diego. P.S. Yes the train does come through the area but it really isn't as bad as some have reported in the reviews. We were on vacation and a little noise from a train wasn't going to bother us. The positive to this is that you can go all over San Diego from the train shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “just fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: fromArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise. It was clean and nicely decorated. We were not troubled by any train noise. Whereas it appeared that they have upgraded the bedding, we found the comforter to be very heavy and uncomfortable; otherwise the bed and pillows were comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was very basic, but more than adequate especially before a cruise! They provided complimentary pickup at the airport and transportation to the pier the next day. We were happy with the accommodations especially for the price and services provided.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price but not as clean as I would like”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego Downtown. The nightly cost was resonable for the area but the hotel has some areas to work on. The front desk staff seamed very lax for a Hilton property. On a positive note, the free morning breakfast was excellent with a fair amount of options. The main draw back was the lack of cleanliness of the rooms. The bathroom was yuck.... and the bed mat was looking pretty rough. Another draw back is the windows didnt seem to block out much noise. There is a train that runs very close to the hotel and It was very annoying in the evening. I wouldnt say I would not stay there again, I would just hope that the next room was handled much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: OC-Lynch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a dinner cruise and stayed at the Hampton Inn for one night. We chose the Hampton because of its proximity to the ship terminal and its price. Despite all the horror stories we read about the trains, we decided to give it a shot. We followed the suggestions and requested a room in the front of the hotel. Our request was honored, but we were at the left corner of the hotel and could see the tracks from our window. I do have to mention that neither of us heard the trains during the night and my husband is a light sleeper. We started hearing them around 7 a.m. the next morning. All I can say about the trains is Wow! I could not believe how loud they are. The hotel itself is very clean and well maintained. Our room was very spacious and well stocked with towels and pillows. The bed was very comfortable. Although the trains didn’t interrupt our sleep, it makes me cautious to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near the Water and the train”
Reviews.Author: IVernazza
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation through Expedia but the hotel had no record of it. The employees were very nice and sorted out the problems with Expedia and honored my resevation. Very unlikely I will use Expedia again. As for the hotel, it is an older Hampton Inn but it was clean with comfortable beds (two queen beds in the room). The drawback is if you are a light to medium sleeper, there is a train and trolly that roll past the Hotel until about 1:00 am then start up around 6:30 am., and when I say roll past, the train tracks border the east side of the hotel property!!!!The hotel will provide ear plugs. The hotel should consider replacing the old windows with more soundproof ones. No one in my group was bothered by the noise. Several hotels in this area are along the train tracks, Hampton Inn is no exception. The breakfast was OK, eggs are not scrambled but folded (??), no potatoes, sausage or bacon, but fruit and bagels. I did come near the end so there were no pastries, etc. No restaurant on the premises, but there is a menu in the room for a nearby restaurant that will deliver. The hotel has nice pool (small as hotels go) and you can see the bay from the pool area. They do charge $10 a day for parking. Within walking distance to the embaradero and a $7 taxi (for three) to the Gaslamp quarter. You spend little time in the room. If you want something closer to Gaslamp, be prepared to spend $100 extra per night. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: keakins
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews before staying at this hotel and was a little nervous. But my stay was great. i was there on business for four days. The hotel staff was wonderful and very helpful with all my needs and provided transportation to convention center and other hotels when needed. My room was great and no noise from the trolleys like everyone wrote about. If you stay there i recommend staying in rooms 227,228,229,230. I stayed in room 230 and it was perfect right in front of the hotel. facing the street no trolley or trains.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus17
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, I have stayed at several Hampton Inns across the country, and this was probably the worst experience I have had. The hotel itself is located right next to the train tracks, so the noise from passing trolleys is very significant. The carpet in my room was in very poor condition. On the first night of my business trip, I found that the shower head did not work, so I requested that it be fixed. The following night, upon returning from a long work day, I found that little repair had been done, so the shower was again barely functioning. Although the hotel is not far from the airport, the hotel shuttle has limited hours. Since the shuttle was not available prior to 6am, I asked the front desk to arrange a taxi pickup so that I could get to the airport in time for my early morning departure flight. The taxi showed up at 05:30 as requested, but another hotel guest whose taxi did NOT show up stole my taxi. This ended up causing several complications for me as I arrived later than planned at the airport and got stuck in a massive line at the airline counter. I have stayed at much better hotels in San Diego, so I doubt that I would stay at this Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “The Trains Are Not A Problem”
Reviews.Author: Good_Journeys
Reviews.Content: We had seen reviews which indicated that we would not be able to sleep due to the proximity of the train tracks - this did not happen. Our room was in the courtyard where noise was supposedly the highest and although we did hear trains during the day, the train traffic drops off in the evening and we were never awakened during the night. This hotel is situated in an excellent location for sightseeing along the harbor, Little Italy , Gaslight district and downtown. The trolley stop is within a block. You can turn in your rental car and save some money. They provide a hot breakfast every morning and the housekeeping is good. The staff is helpful and friendly. This is a great buy for downtown San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location, This is the place when I come back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcats72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading the reviews.. I payed $130+$10 to park. Very cheep in San Diego. Bigger name hotels are near by and cost $200+ and they don't offer anymore than this Hampton. The rooms were very clean and new looking. The staff was very helpful. The gaslamp, seaport village, old town, Balboa park are very close with a trolley stop right out side..

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy - trains and air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: JamesManchester
Reviews.Content: I was initially sceptical about the impact of the trains when I read the reviews on trip advisor - however I've now learnt my lesson. The trains were extremely noisy - despite me asking for a quiet room on checkin (as a HiltonHHonors Gold member). I asked to change rooms after hearing the first train and was told no other rooms were available. The air conditioning in the room was exceedingly noisy and we couldn't have it turned on whilst we slept. On checkout, we used the 100% satisfaction guarantee and got the room for free on the basis of the poor noise insulation and the noisy air con. The receptionist told us that we had a 'quiet' room - I don't want to think about what a noisy one is like. My advice would be to avoid this hotel. Everything else was fine and the bed was good but in San Diego's climate, you need a cool and quiet room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but NOISY TRAINS”
Reviews.Author: grahamkuk
Reviews.Content: As the final part of our journey down Route 66 we decided to return to San Diego again having stayed here (in another hotel) 3 years ago, plus we do not like Santa Monica (we stayed 55 minutes to take photos at the end of the Mother Road). We stayed here for 4 nights on the basis of the location and comments. I was slightly concerned about some of the review comments about the trains and trams - my concerns were well founded. We had two rooms, one facing the back and the train lines and the other on the side facing down town. I heard the first trains and tried to move rooms but no others were available that night. My Wife usually sleeps through most noise but this room was the exception. Neither of us slept all night - what a racket these trains make - hooting and tooting all night long - and during the day. Our Daughters stayed in the other room and were also wakened but not as much. We moved next day into a side facing room which was a bit quieter but we still never got a full sleep. It's a real shame because in every other way this hotel is great. It has an integral car park, a swimming pool facing the sea / naval base, fantastic complimentary breakfast and is within walking distance of down town. You can take the trams but at $2 a ride why bother - the exercise does you good. Perhaps double glazing is needed to cut out the noise or the toiletries should include earplugs but that would be unsafe - you might not hear the fire alarm. So if you are a trainspotter this hotel will do you fine, if you are a light sleeper (like me) then perhaps the Holiday Inn just over a bit from this hotel and further away from the trains is the better choice - it's where we will go next time. It's a real shame that the hotel was built so close to the rails - see my photos.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, but....”
Reviews.Author: MetMan
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is a terrific value in downtown San Diego, just a block from the waterfront and the Star of India, as well as the maritime museum. Also, a short walk to the Gaslight District for great restaurants and nightlife. We even walked to Petco Park for a Padres game. The trolley stops right behind the hotel for convenient transportation to other area attractions. However, that's the rub. You can hear the trolley's and trains quite clearly, and the trains go through all night. There is a crossing which clangs as well. I wore my noise cancelling headphones to bed! The hotel itself appears to be quite new, with wonderful rooms and bright, cheerful decor. If you're a sound sleeper, it's a great value!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn San Diego - Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1531 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
